[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #577](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/577/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

I have a hard time parsing this for sheer volume. Is there a way to split this into two separate pull requests? One that introduces the new API (without breaking the old) and one that makes use of the new API in existing code?

I did a pass. One additional comment: There are many added `//TODO` comments linking this to ongoing work to remove protobuf support. For those: Please file the JIRAs that should resolve the `TODO` comments and add the JIRA id to the comment.
I am fine to leave the responsibility to the caller.
Let's move the discussion of a good `null` policy for .NET to the mailing list and then revisit.
@jwang98052 can you also have a look? Does this look like it can be replicated in Tang.NET?

This looks good to me, with one minor glitch: The changed files have lots of unused `using` statements. Can you go through them and remove?

Schema looks looks good. .Net Tang can make the similar change with the shared schema. I can work on .Net side as we have .Net environment handy and it might be better to verify it by second person from .Net side. But if Yunseong likes to work on .Net, that is totally fine as well :)

Simple commit to "modularize" the change. Next steps are to pass the available racks to the ContainerManager in the local runtime. Lastly, we will define the API of how users will express their preferences regarding racks, nodes, and relax locality.
